intro: Hieracium villadraeum, commonly known as the Villadraean hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant features upright, hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow, with ray florets that are typically shorter than the central disk florets. Hieracium villadraeum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
